data.title: Real Salt Lake
data.meta_description: Everything you need to know for attending a match or event at Rio Tinto Stadium.
data.text:
ADA POLICIES:

Accessible/Disabled Parking â Accessible parking spaces are available in the West, South, and East parking lots located at the stadium. There are a limited number of ADA stalls available and are on a first-come, first served basis. Parking passes are required for these lots and are $20/game for Real Salt Lake, $15/game for Utah Royals FC and variable prices for ancillary events. Please see map.

Gates â The West, South, North, and East gates are ADA accessible. The Spanish Stairs gate is NOT ADA accessible. South Stands ADA ticketholders and Field ADA ticketholders will need to enter at the Staff Entrance located on the West side of the stadium.

Passenger Drop-Off Zone â A drop-off and pick-up zone is located in the East Parking Lot at America First Field. To enter, when driving Southbound on State Street, enter the lot just beyond the main East Entrance to the stadium. There are 2 lanes for passenger pickup and dropoff. No loitering or parking is allowed.

Restrooms â All public and family restrooms are accessible for our guests with disabilities. The family restroom is located on the southeast concourse near section 5.

Service Animals â Certified service dogs for guests with disabilities are welcome at the stadium. All other animals are prohibited from entering. Only dogs recognized as service animals under titles II and III of the ADA are considered certified.

Wheelchairs â America First Field does not lend or rent wheelchairs to patrons for events. Wheelchairs are utilized by the First Aid stand for transportation only.

Wheelchair and Companion Seating â The stadium provides wheelchair and companion seating. Sections 2, 4, 6, 7, 8, 12, 14, 26, 27, 30, 31, 35, 37, 202, 204, 235, 237, & Field have ADA seating. The âField ADAâ section is only accessible via the Staff Entrance on the West Side of the stadium. The 200 level ADA sections are only accessible via the East elevator located on the East side of the main concourse. Please ask a Guest Services staff member for assistance in locating the elevators. For assistance purchasing ADA seating, please call 844-REAL-TIX or click here.

Sensory Kits - Fans with sensory needs will now have access to Sensory Kits. Sensory kits are located at the Guest Services Office on the East concourse of the stadium. Each Sensory Kit comes with Headphones and 3 Fidget Toys. These are available for free to be lended and returned at each event.

Quiet Space: After Kick Off, The Upper Playground located on the Plaza will become a quiet space. The quiet space is available for anyone who needs a break or calm space during the match.

EVACUATION PROCEDURES:

Being prepared in an emergency is one of the most important things to remember. Familiarize yourself with the closest exit or emergency exit in your area. Families or groups should pre-designate a meeting location outside the stadium in the event that they become separated in an evacuation. If you have any questions about the nearest exit locations, please ask one of our Guest Services Staff Members for assistance. Always remember to remain calm and follow the instructions of the staff and public address announcements. For everyoneâs safety please evacuate your area in an orderly manner.

Communication from the stadium during emergencies will come via PA announcement, videoboard displays, social media posts, emails, or through our fan messaging platform TITAN HST (scan the QR codes around the stadium to sign-up).

TRANSPORTATION:

America First Field has several options for public transportation options for events.

SHUTTLE:

For Real Salt Lake matches only

The stadium provides a free ADA-compliant shuttle service from Sandy City Hall. Pickup begins 2 hours prior to event start at the bus stop along Monroe Street, adjacent to City Hall. Passengers will get dropped off and picked up at the North Gate at America First Field. Shuttles will run for at least one hour post-event.

At this time there are no shuttles for Utah Royals FC matches.

Times and availability may vary for other stadium events. Shuttle times will be adjusted for extracurricular activities (i.e. fireworks) or weather delays as needed.

TRAX:

TRAX is the local light-rail train for the Salt Lake area. Numerous UTA TRAX routes service three stations that are all within a 15-minute walk of the stadium. These include the Historic Sandy Station (at 9000 South and 200 East), the Sandy Expo Station (at 9400 South, behind Jordan Commons), and the Sandy Civic Center Station (at 10000 South, behind Jordan High School). Please visit www.rideUTA.com for additional information.
